result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Activity: initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:36 PM  Defendant Krystal L. Scott in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Walter H Isaacson also appearing by video.  David Zarwell   and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.   Signature bond set of $1000.00   with conditions, May not possess any weapons. No contact directly or indirectly with victim DDC, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney. Adjourned initial appearance May 25, 2022 at 1:00 pm.
